availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas H. Hunt (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, Rope & Bag Factory Owner, CSA Colonel )

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, rope & bag factory owner and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Hunt. Father of Alex T. Hunt, Anna F. Hunt, Edward Hunt, and Henrietta Hunt. Rope & Factory Owner in Louisville in 1860. Served as Colonel in the 9th Kentucky Infantry (C.S.A.) from October 1, 1861 to April 22, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 4, p. 64.
Find A Grave, "Thomas H. Hunt (January 02, 1815- May 06, 1884)," Memorial #6266777, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6266777 (accessed April x, 2019).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 410-411.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 2 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 262-263
